programme.title: Mark Goodier's US No.1s of 1985
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 Mark Goodier's US No.1s of 1985
programme.desc: 60 minutes of back to back US chart toppers from 1985 - some you might know well, some you might not! Including Jan Hammer, REO Speedwagon & Ready For The World.

programme.title: Simon Bates Golden Hour: 1986
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 Simon Bates Golden Hour: 1986
programme.desc: 60 minutes of hits & headlines from the year of Top Gun, The Mir Space Station, Oprah Winfrey's TV debut and the launch of Samantha Fox's music career!

programme.title: The Hit Factory! SAW's Big Hits
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 The Hit Factory! SAW's Big Hits
programme.desc: Hits that rocked the UK's dancefloors in the 80s from the mega production trio Stock, Aitken & Waterman. Expect Kylie, Jason, Rick, Sonia & Sinitta.

programme.title: Is This Really How They Started?
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 Is This Really How They Started?
programme.desc: Most went onto much bigger things - but how did it all start? Here are 25 chart & video debuts from household names - some songs are brilliant, but some you might not know!

programme.title: 1987 Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights & iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1987!

programme.title: Coiffured! Rick v Jason
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 Coiffured! Rick v Jason
programme.desc: 12 of the best hairstyles of the late 80s - these boys knew how to use a comb and a bucketful of mousse.

programme.title: 80s Eurodance! Top 25
programme.desc: 25 fabulous dance tracks from the UK and across Europe.

programme.title: 60 Summer Sizzlers! 1980-1989
programme.desc: 60 of the best feel-good summer hits! Each was a Top 10 smash across June, July & August in the '80s - on the beach, on your walkman, and at the Radio 1 Roadshow!

programme.title: 1987 Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights & iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1987!

programme.title: The NOW Yearbook 1987
programme.desc: Jenny Powell flicks through the pages of another Yearbook. 1987 had 'No Limits' on the TV & Stock, Aitken & Waterman cranking an endless stream of massive, catchy hits!

programme.title: The Last Days of Disco! 1980-1982
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 The Last Days of Disco! 1980-1982
programme.desc: Disco wasn't just a 70s thing - the early 80s had some cracking tunes as well. With Diana Ross, Three Degrees, Abba, Odyssey, Boys Town Gang & The Gibson Brothers.

programme.title: Feelgood Friday!
programme.desc: Feelgood hits from just 1 decade - the 1970s! Platform boots & flares at the ready?

programme.title: Pat Sharp's 25 Silly Songs!
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 Pat Sharp's 25 Silly Songs!
programme.desc: 2 hours of funny videos, silly songs & novelty hits - all of them amazing and all in the best possible taste!

programme.title: I Love The Night Life! Top 25
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 I Love The Night Life! Top 25
programme.desc: If you love the night life, and you gotta boogie, then NOW 70s has a 2 hour antidote. Turn up those disco lights and strap on the roller skates! Oh yeah!

programme.title: Top Singalongs! 1970-1979
programme.desc: In order - 5 hours of the biggest karaoke anthems of the 70s - from Mungo Jerry & T.Rex to Abba, Blondie & Queen. Prepare to sing out loud!

programme.title: Abba Gold! 1974-1979
programme.desc: Quite simply the biggest hits from the biggest pop act of the 70s - Abba. 12 songs, 7 UK number 1s.

programme.title: Top Singalongs! 1970-1979
programme.desc: In order - 5 hours of the biggest karaoke anthems of the 70s - from Mungo Jerry & T.Rex to Abba, Blondie & Queen. Prepare to sing out loud!

programme.title: No.1 Air Guitar Anthems! 1970-1979
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 No.1 Air Guitar Anthems! 1970-1979
programme.desc: Dust down your air guitar, cause we've 11 rock number 1s from the 70s to strum along to! From Hendrix & Queen to Suzi Q & Dave Edmunds.

programme.title: Who Won Wot in 1971?
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 Who Won Wot in 1971?
programme.desc: Mark Goodier with 1971's big music award winners. Who was 'Best Newcomer' at the Grammys & which comedian got the coveted UK Christmas Number 1?

programme.title: Hamilton's Hotshots! Top 30
programme.desc: In the mid-70s Diddy David Hamilton was on Radio 1 AND Radio 2 at the same time! And these are a choice selection of his records of the week - his "Hamilton's Hotshots"!

programme.title: Summer Loving!
programme.desc: Non-stop summer love songs, back to back, from the era of Leo Sayer, Carpenters, The Bee Gees & Minnie Ripperton.

programme.title: NOW 100 Hits: Love Songs!
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 NOW 100 Hits: Love Songs!
programme.desc: Simon Bates with the ultimate countdown of 70s love songs. 100 songs with heartfelt vocals, lush strings & big breakdowns in an 8 hour marathon! Expect Chicago, Eric Carmen & 10cc.

programme.title: Summer Loving!
programme.desc: Non-stop summer love songs, back to back, from the era of Leo Sayer, Carpenters, The Bee Gees & Minnie Ripperton.

programme.title: What The Heck Kept This Off No.1?
programme.sub-title: S00 : E00 What The Heck Kept This Off No.1?
programme.desc: Every one of these superb No.2 hits from 1970-1979 is a classic, but what other songs stopped each of them getting to the top? Queen, Ringo, Elton, Boney M and more are all here!

programme.title: Tony Blackburn's 70s Soul!
programme.desc: Slick ballads, funky beats & soulful disco - Tony has the lot in a 2 hour session of sensational 70s soul!

programme.desc: Power upgrades are great especially if you can bolt-on big performance in a day. Mike and Pat grab some wrenches to install a ProCharger supercharger on a 2019 Challenger ProCharger.

programme.title: Truck Tech
programme.desc: Our 2011 Diesel Denali nicknamed "Dragonali" gets lowered & de-badged, plus we're in a viewers' driveway rescuing their beat up pick-up.

programme.title: Music City Trucks
programme.desc: We upgrade the brakes, repair underside problems, and put some great new off-road and recovery mods on our 2007 Jeep Wrangler JK. Then we'll take it out for a wheeling adventure.

programme.title: Music City Trucks
programme.desc: The team ventures to the north Georgia mountains to pick up and test an '07 Jeep Wrangler JK, then we head to the Summit Racing store in search of parts to mod it for extreme off-road fun!

programme.title: Detroit Muscle
programme.desc: The Detroit Muscle team begins their journey of bringing a '69 Plymouth Road Runner back from the brink. The first step, upping its ground game.

programme.title: Engine Power
programme.desc: Today, it's do or die. We connect TWO 496 Big Block Chevy engines to the dyno to find out exactly how much power two of the same engine will make running in tandem!

programme.title: Detroit Muscle
programme.desc: The '69 Road Runner gets an exterior upgrade. We'll show you some unorthodox methods for enhancing a patina paint look.

programme.title: Detroit Muscle
programme.desc: Our '69 Road Runner, nicknamed Road Burner, gets a big bump in power when we perform a Gen III Hemi engine swap.

programme.title: Music City Trucks
programme.desc: We're turning our 1964 Ford Flatbed into a shop truck! With the help of the team in Engine Power, the guys make an engine swap that includes a turbo! Plus we're off to the junkyard in search of a transmission.

programme.title: Engine Power
programme.desc: We do something that has never been done before: build two identical 496 Big Block Chevy engines to run on the dyno...at the SAME TIME!!

programme.title: Carcass
programme.desc: We show you painting tips on how to properly prep your aging clear coat for paint. Then we give our Mazda a fresh look before heading to the track to test those performance parts!

programme.title: Carcass
programme.desc: We start working on a new project with the novice racer in mind. We take a 2008 Ford Crown Vic Police Cruiser and turn it into a budget-friendly Spec Panther racing machine! Today we'll upgrade our transmission for better shifting and give the old power plant a tune-up.

programme.title: Carcass
programme.desc: The Carcass duo add power, and huge tires to the Willys mud wagon for the ultimate mud adventure.

programme.title: Detroit Muscle
programme.desc: Drag Strip Swap - Tommy and Joel elevate the curb appeal of an old 1967 Chevy Nova race car, showing you how to swap out some shiny stuff, which includes new bumpers and trim, as well as beef up the fire suppression system to get it looking cool and staying cool.

programme.title: Engine Power
programme.desc: Last year we built a 350 ci Small Block Chevy in the parking lot. This year it comes inside for some well-deserved upgrades to the short block assembly.

programme.title: Truck Tech
programme.desc: Modifying a Duramax to make high power starts with a teardown and some machining before the new performance parts are added. Plus Austin mods up the body for a cool clean look.

programme.title: Music City Trucks
programme.desc: We upgrade the brakes, repair underside problems, and put some great new off-road and recovery mods on our 2007 Jeep Wrangler JK. Then we'll take it out for a wheeling adventure.

programme.title: 10 Days South Africa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 10 Days South Africa Durban
programme.desc: Alex Outhwaite takes a helicopter ride over Drakensberg mountain, and explores the untouched wilderness of Kagga Kamma Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Bucket List Itoshima, Japan
programme.desc: Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty enjoy treks to waterfalls, fishing and a serene beach sunset in Itoshima - a place in Kyushu which calms the soul.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Boarding Pass Oslo, Norway
programme.desc: Norway’s metropolitan capital Oslo is infectious. Jamie succumbs to his adventurous desires at Oslo Winter Park and Holmenkollen when he goes skiing and zip lining. He next checks in to postcard-worthy landmarks including the Norwegian Parliament, Eidsvolls Plass and Noble Peace Center. A visit to Frogner Park which boasts of unique art installations makes his day. The episode also unveils a gallery, only one of its kind in the world! Any guesses?

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: On a short break in Belfast, the capital of Northern Ireland, Olivia, an avid traveller, finds herself infected by the energy of the city at a traditional Victorian market. At the city’s main attractions like Belfast City Hall and Belfast Castle, she gets to know its history. She also visits the Ulster Museum, which tells her stories about the Egyptians in Ireland, and Titanic Belfast, which makes the grand ship and its downfall come alive for her.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Great World Hotels Desroches 2
programme.desc: Seychelles, with its idyllic natural beauty and slow-paced life is the perfect destination to commune with nature. When Freishia visits this cluster of jewels in the Indian Ocean, she chances upon a tortoise feeding pen and her conversation with the team there gives her insights into the efforts taken by the Island Conservation Society to preserve the beauty of Seychelles.

programme.title: Xp Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 XP Guide Oslo 2, Norway
programme.desc: Perhaps the most famous period in Norwegian history was the Viking Age. Far from just barbaric, axe-wielding invaders, the Vikings were Norse seafarers who left a major impact on European history through trade, colonization, and far-flung exploration. During Elisha’s visit to Oslo, she finds herself in awe of the extraordinary well-designed Viking ships at a museum, where she comes to know fascinating stories about the lives led by the Vikings.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E17 Backpack Mt. Bromo & Komodo National Par, Indonesia
programme.desc: Hannah wraps up from Jog Jakarta after her visit to Sultan’s palace and heads to East Java’s capital, Bromo, for a thrilling experience of watching an active volcano. Keeping the adrenalin on, she visits Komodo National Park for sighting the world’s largest reptile - Komodo Dragon.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.desc: Looking for a break from the chaos and stress of city life, Asmita decides to visit Haridwar, a place which she had last visited with her family as a child. Wanting to recreate those blissful moments, she heads off to this town nestled on the banks of the mighty river Ganga, where pilgrims and weary souls come to find respite. Little does she know that, in her short stay there, the town is going to open her eyes to the joys of slow living.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Food Fact Fun Toronto, Canada
programme.desc: Vietnamese sandwich shop is Alex’s first stop in Toronto where he tries the Kimchi fries. Further explores the Market 707 for some asian food shops. Next he visits the Casa Loma castle and then Sir Henry’s garage for classic cars and finally explores and interacts with shopkeepers in Saint Lauren’s Market. Next, Alex in Ontario exploring the place on Segway. For some adventure, he then tries Skydiving at iFLY and to end his day with paddle boating.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Bucket List Aso, Japan
programme.desc: Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty try some adventurous activities at Mount Aso, the caldera that is home to Japan’s most active volcano.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: There is no better place to feel ‘duende’, the spirit and passion of Spain than its lively capital, Madrid. Alex catches some of the city’s infectious liveliness at its bustling squares such as Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor. She experiences the Spaniards’ love for food as she tucks into authentic Spanish churros. She also finds out about the city’s rich and complex history at places such as Cathedral de la Almudena and Madrid’s Royal Palace.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E23 City Breaks Jaipur, India
programme.desc: A quick escape to Jaipur introduces Asmita to the stark contrast in the old and new sides of Rajasthan’s capital city. On the one hand, she has a tryst with the global cosmopolis that attracts business and luxury travelers from all over the world. On the other hand, the regal monuments of the region reveal to her the stories of the kings who built them.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: From being the primary mode of transport for many centuries to helping in the production of olive oil, the donkeys in Cyprus have truly earned the status of the national animal. Our host, Sabrina Chakici finds out more about them and their significance to the country when she visits a donkey farm. She also visits Akamas Peninsula National Park, one of the island country’s last remaining wildernesses.

programme.title: 10 Days Estonia
programme.desc: Tallinn, Estonia’s capital, is known for its quaint, medieval Old Town but Italian nomad couple, Marco and Erica discover other sides to the city by visiting offbeat attractions such as the Seaplane Harbour Museum and Telliskivi Creative City, a hub of artists. They also tuck into a medieval feast at Olde Hansa Inn. Following this, they have an off-roading adventure at Aidu oil shale quarry.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Boarding Pass Helsinki, Finland
programme.desc: Renowned journalist and traveler, Emeline Nsingi Nkosi visits the colourful, clean and minimalist seaside city of Helsinki, the capital of Finland. Here, she explores the iconic attractions, right from magnificent historical fortresses and monuments to churches and libraries with groundbreaking design. She finds out that Helsinki offers a fascinating journey through centuries of evolving architecture and style. She also pampers herself at a Finnish sauna.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Boarding Pass Ruka Kuusamo, Finland
programme.desc: Levi offers all the excitement and comforts for a truly memorable holiday in Lapland’s wilderness. It is, however, the local ways of life that attract Emeline Nsingi Nkosi, as she joins the residents of Levi in foraging, cooking and eating, and learns from them about Sisu - the Finnish secret to happiness. Following this, she goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder, who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer in Finland.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Bucket List Aso, Japan
programme.desc: Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty try some adventurous activities at Mount Aso, the caldera that is home to Japan’s most active volcano.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Boarding Pass Helsinki, Finland
programme.desc: Renowned journalist and traveler, Emeline Nsingi Nkosi visits the colourful, clean and minimalist seaside city of Helsinki, the capital of Finland. Here, she explores the iconic attractions, right from magnificent historical fortresses and monuments to churches and libraries with groundbreaking design. She finds out that Helsinki offers a fascinating journey through centuries of evolving architecture and style. She also pampers herself at a Finnish sauna.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Boarding Pass Ruka Kuusamo, Finland
programme.desc: Levi offers all the excitement and comforts for a truly memorable holiday in Lapland’s wilderness. It is, however, the local ways of life that attract Emeline Nsingi Nkosi, as she joins the residents of Levi in foraging, cooking and eating, and learns from them about Sisu - the Finnish secret to happiness. Following this, she goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder, who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer in Finland.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Bucket List Aso, Japan
programme.desc: Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty try some adventurous activities at Mount Aso, the caldera that is home to Japan’s most active volcano.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: There is no better place to feel ‘duende’, the spirit and passion of Spain than its lively capital, Madrid. Alex catches some of the city’s infectious liveliness at its bustling squares such as Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor. She experiences the Spaniards’ love for food as she tucks into authentic Spanish churros. She also finds out about the city’s rich and complex history at places such as Cathedral de la Almudena and Madrid’s Royal Palace.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E23 City Breaks Jaipur, India
programme.desc: A quick escape to Jaipur introduces Asmita to the stark contrast in the old and new sides of Rajasthan’s capital city. On the one hand, she has a tryst with the global cosmopolis that attracts business and luxury travelers from all over the world. On the other hand, the regal monuments of the region reveal to her the stories of the kings who built them.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: From being the primary mode of transport for many centuries to helping in the production of olive oil, the donkeys in Cyprus have truly earned the status of the national animal. Our host, Sabrina Chakici finds out more about them and their significance to the country when she visits a donkey farm. She also visits Akamas Peninsula National Park, one of the island country’s last remaining wildernesses.

programme.title: Red Bull Erzbergrodeo recap
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Red Bull Erzbergrodeo recap
programme.desc: Red Bull KTM Factory Racing’s Manuel Lettenbichler put on a masterclass in Austria, claiming a comfortable win over FMF KTM Factory Racing’s Trystan Hart and Sherco Factory Racing’s Mario Roman.

programme.title: Don't Look Down
programme.desc: 2,000ft in the air. Sub-zero temperatures. Who said you can't ride a BMX park in the sky? This is how Kriss Kyle's daring idea grew into a mind-boggling feat of aeronautical engineering and BMX-riding skill.

programme.title: How Luke Czepiela landed a plane on a tiny helipad
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 How Luke Czepiela landed a plane on a tiny helipad
programme.desc: Luke Czepiela pushed the limits of aviation and landed a plane on the famous helipad of Burj Al Arab Jumeirah in Dubai. We take a closer look behind the scenes of the project with unique footage.

programme.title: Tunnel Pass
programme.desc: A lifetime project completed in 44 seconds. On September 4, 2021, Italian pilot Dario Costa attempted to fly his race plane at 303,8kph through Turkey’s dual Çatalca Tunnels.

programme.title: Highlights – Malaga Premier Padel P1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Highlights – Malaga Premier Padel P1
programme.desc: Relive the action from Spain – one of the world's most popular countries for the sport – as the world's best padel players tackled the Malaga Premier Padel P1.

programme.title: World’s fastest filming drone chases Max Verstappen
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 World’s fastest filming drone chases Max Verstappen
programme.desc: Watch Formula One track action at Silverstone like never before. The fastest-ever filming FPV drone keeps up with Liam Lawson, David Coulthard and Max Verstappen as they reach speeds of over 300kph.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.sub-title: S2024 : E06 BRC: Round 6: Ypres Rally
programme.desc: The 59th Ardeca Ypres Rally, the sixth round of the Belgian rally championship, remained exciting until the absolute final phase. The pace was particularly high at the front, which caused a lot of slips and mistakes. Even the winner did not remain flawless. Yet Stéphane Lefebvre was clearly the fastest. The 32-year-old Nordist, who as a child was a fascinated spectator watching the rally cars in Ypres, won with a lead of 40″46 over Maxime Potty, while Cédric Cherain finished third.

programme.title: BTCC
programme.sub-title: S00 : E07 BTCC 2024: Round 7 - Knockhill Story of the day
programme.desc: BTCC Round up from the seventh event of the year! Tom Ingram goes into the weekend leading the championship but will start race one from 15th. With the grid out of shape from championship order and under the Scottish sun, who will leave the Fife-based circuit after a chaotic day at Knockhill!

programme.title: Porsche Cup Brasil

programme.title: The Road to Success - Emil Frey Lexus Racing Team

programme.title: Driving La Carrera: Rally Brothers
programme.desc: The world’s greatest auto races fuel every driver’s passion for competition and adventure. But one race offers something more. La Carrera Panamericana unites competitors unlike any other race. This unity is the Spirit of La Carrera. This spirit gave birth to the documentary “Driving La Carrera, Rally Brother.” Two brothers, Chris and Jeff Mason, find out that racing in the Carrera Panamericana is more than just winning.

programme.title: Behind The Visor with Nico Hülkenberg
programme.desc: He may have taken 3 years out of full-time F1, but Nico Hülkenberg certainly hasn't lost the motivation to push himself. Earlier in the year, we caught up with the Hulk himself, where Nico opens up on his early retirement the first time around, his comeback with Haas and his future with Audi in F1.

programme.title: FIA Karting
programme.sub-title: S2024 : E04 FIA Karting: Round 4: MotorLand Aragón
programme.desc: Apart from a spell of rain late on Saturday, the MotorLand Aragón track provided good grip for the powerful machines competing. The Dunlop tyres performed well in all three categories, whatever the conditions. With its width, the 1,671-metre-long Spanish track enabled plenty of overtaking in all the races, while remaining highly selective. The Spanish organising team showed great skill and much appreciated personal qualities.

programme.title: E-Xplorer FIM World Cup
programme.sub-title: S2024 : E01 E-Xplorer FIM World Cup // Osaka, Japan // Episode 1
programme.desc: Honda Racing Corporation (Team HRC) has claimed victory in its native Japan at the opening round of the 2024 FIM E-Xplorer World Cup, stamping its authority in electric off-road racing in only its first competition.

programme.title: Hypercar’s Golden Age – WEC 2023 Season Review
programme.desc: The much anticipated 2023 World Endurance season promised larger grids and more manufacturer support as teams like Ferrari, Peugeot, Porsche and Cadillac all joined the Hypercar class in hopes of challenging Toyota for top honors. While Ferrari managed to make history in winning the centenary running of Le Mans, it was a season of learnings up and down the grid as Toyota won their 5th straight Drivers and Manufacturers Championships.

programme.title: F1 2024 The Season So Far - Surprises and Disappointments
programme.desc: From what seemed like a forgone conclusion at the start of the season, with Max Verstappen and Red Bull winning 7 of the 10 opening races, has quickly turned on its head with the rest of the field fast approaching. With the early season pace of Ferrari faltering, and McLaren charging to the head of the field to challenge Red Bull, and Mercedes coming up as well, this is the review of the first half of the 2024 Formula 1 season.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.desc: A four-man one-night heavyweight tournament will take centre stage with the winner punching his ticket into the historic end of year GLORY Heavyweight Grand Prix for a chance to win a life-changing $500,000. The four participants are Dutch giant Martin Terpstra (21-5, 11 KO), former light heavyweight title contender Mohamed Amine (29-5, 16 KO), the explosive Bahram Rajabzadeh (62-1, 56 KO), and the bruising power puncher Uku Jürjendal (18-7, 14 KO). A huge international title fight will feature in the co-main event as Tyjani Beztati (24-4, 9 KO) will put his GLORY lightweight championship on the line against Japanese star Kaito Ono (51-6-1, 22 KO).

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.desc: A huge title fight rematch will take place in the main event as rivals Tiffany ‘Time Bomb’ van Soest (24-6-2, 9 KO) and Sarah Moussaddak (8-3, 1 KO) lock horns once again. The rest of the card is stacked with some exciting names and thrilling fights. French Algerian Nordine Mahieddine (27-15, 12 KO) collides with France’s Abderahmane Coulibaly (58-20-1, 25 KO) in a big heavyweight contest, Germany’s Denis Wosik (37-8-1, 9 KO) meets the super popular Albanian Berjan Peposhi (27-3, 16 KO), former GLORY title challenger Karim Ghajji (103-17-1, 53 KO) returns and squares-off against Serbia’s Nikola Todorovic (26-3, 14 KO), and Iliass Hammouche (32-6, 7 KO) will finally make his much...

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.desc: Endy Semeleer (35-1, 17 KO) will put his GLORY welterweight title on the line against ‘House of GLORY’ winner Anwar Ouled-Chaib (3-0) in the main event. In the co-main event, local fan favourite Nabil Khachab (26-4-1, 4 KO) finally gets his opportunity to enter the GLORY Grand Prix as he goes up against Serbia’s Nikola Filipovic (11-2, 6 KO) in a qualifying fight. Number one ranked Enriko Kehl (52-15-2, 30 KO) will be aiming undeniably book his spot as the next title challenger against champion Tyjani Beztati. The German meets the dangerous Arman Hambaryan (58-8-2, 27 KO) of Armenia.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.sub-title: S00 : E01 GLORY Heavyweight Grand Prix 2024
programme.desc: 3 wins to come out on top, who's it going to be? Rico Verhoeven, Levi Rigters, Tarik Osaro, Benjamin Adegbuyi, Sofian Laidouni, Uku Jurjendal, Bahram Rajabzadeh, and Nabil Khachab pair up and throw down for the GLORY Heavyweight Grand Prix, an 8-man 1-night heavyweight tournament for the ages.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.desc: It's the fight everyone wants to see as GLORY Heavyweight champion, Rico Verhoeven takes on Badr Hari. Plus, the Welterweight title is on the line as Nieky Holzken meets Cedric Doumbé.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.desc: From the Forest National in Brussels, Belgium on October 6, 2012. This event featured a super fight between Remy Bonjasky and Anderson Silva as headliner, Also this event featured non-tournament super fight series.

programme.title: GLORY 94 Prelims LIVE
programme.desc: The GLORY 94 prelims will be headlined by ‘House of GLORY’ winner Anwar Ouled-Chaib (3-1) against France’s Cedric Tousch (31-2, 19 KO) and will feature a host of new talent all vying to make an impact in their respective GLORY debuts. 5 fights in 2 hours!

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.desc: The GLORY welterweight title will be on the line in the main event as the reigning & defending champion Endy Semeleer (35-1, 17 KO) welcomes the challenge of top contender Chico Kwasi (42-5, 22 KO). In the co-main event, after his crazy GLORY Heavyweight Grand Prix performance, the wild & exciting Bahram Rajabzadeh (66-2, 58 KO) steps down to light heavyweight and meets the hard-hitting Paris-based Kevin Oumar (33-4, 7 KO), a French kickboxing champion & budding MMA star. Belgian-Moroccan superstar Youssef Boughanem (187-43-8, 119 KO) steps into the GLORY ring for the very first time in his illustrious career as he meets the Ukraine’s Stanislav Kazantsev (25-8-1, 7 KO). The best of French...

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.desc: Donovan Wisse (20-1, 10 KO) puts his middleweight championship on the line against number one contender Ulric Bokeme (32-4, 17 KO) in the main event of the evening. Wisse is one of the top P4P kickboxers on the planet today and is chasing his fourth straight title defense. After his Grand Prix heroics, the number one ranked heavyweight Levi Rigters (17-2, 8 KO) returns to action to take on dangerous late notice replacement Nico Pereira Horta (22-8, 3 KO) in the co-main event. The ‘King of The Hague’ crown is up for grabs when rivals Michael Boapeah (16-4-1, 7 KO) and Serkan Ozcaglayan (45-9, 36 KO) clash. The two top middleweights meet in this local derby match-up where the winner walks...

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing

programme.desc: The eight-man one-night GLORY Light Heavyweight Grand Prix will crown the baddest light heavyweight striker on the planet. The eight participants are: GLORY champion, #C Tarik Khbabez (58-10-1, 28 KO), Morocco. Former champion, #1 Donegi Abena (27-10, 7 KO), Suriname. Former champion, #2 Sergej Maslobojev (38-6, 23 KO), Lithuania. Undefeated in GLORY, #3 Stefan Latescu (17-2, 8 KO), Romania. ‘Mister Cool’ #4 Ibrahim El Bouni (41-9-1, 22 KO), Morocco. The wild & unpredictable, #5 Bahram Rajabzadeh (67-2, 59 KO), Azerbaijan. Top French light heavyweight, #6 Pascal Toure (20-6, 7 KO), France. Veteran fighter, #7 Bogdan Stoica (58-14, 40 KO), Romania.

programme.title: DAY IN THE LIFE OF A COACH
programme.sub-title: S01 : E19 DAY IN THE LIFE OF A COACH
programme.desc: Fabricio Santos De Jesus was introduced to Judo as a child while he was still living in Brazil. He was also introduced to Capoeira, becoming Champion of Brazil and International Capoeira Champion. He has been able to transfer his knowledge of the control of movement and is now recognized for this knowledge as a coach in MMA community. Hard Knocks Fighter Jess Elverum, among others, using his teachings to expand their flexibility and dexterity, becoming more fluid and calm in movement.

programme.title: DAY IN THE LIFE OF A COACH
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 DAY IN THE LIFE OF A COACH
programme.desc: CJ Hollett is a Brazilian Jiu Jitsu Black Belt who loves teaching his craft. He is very well respected as an MMA coach for his technical mindset, high level skills and experience coaching UFC fighters. CJ loves working with MMA fighters because of their hunger to win, and believes it's time for Jiu Jitsu to make a resurgence in the MMA cage.
